  • Removed the AI's remote mech unit at round start and tweaked its charger positioning; the AI can still receive and operate remote mechs added to its network by robotics.

mikomyazaki updated:

  • Closets, chairs, etc. without a mob inside/buckled will not cause a slowdown when being dragged.

mikomyazaki & MattAtlas updated:

  • Players now have vision cones, preventing seeing mobs in a 90 degree arc behind themselves, unless that mob is grabbing you.
  • You can adjust the darkness of your FOV cone in the global preferences menu of character setup.
  • Diona do not have vision cones.
  • Bluespace Technicians do not have vision cones, and have a verb to toggle it.
  • You now walk slower if you are moving in the direction opposite to your facing direction.
  • The Face Direction verb now only prevents you from changing direction with the movement keys, clicking will allow you to change your facing direction in this mode.
  • There are now 'Visible Emote' and 'Audible Emote' verbs in the IC tab. Please note that visible emotes will not be visible if they originate from a mob inside your blind-spot.

20 September 2020

Alberyk updated:

  • Fixed the .45 magazines having no proper sprite.

Geeves updated:

  • Cleaned up some Shield Generator code, and added some text to generated shields being hit by projectiles, making it more clear that projectiles can dissipate those shields.
  • Added a version of the unathi big horn that has no side horns.

The Stryker, NewOriginalSchwann updated:

  • Adds a Gadpathur accent with description by Schwann.

19 September 2020

DanseMacabre updated:

  • Changed the STS, WT-550, gauss gun, and blaster sprites.
  • Full auto nerf, rifle damage buff.

FirinMaLazors updated:

  • Fixes airlock deconstruction to only needs the bolts to be cut if the bolts are down and the door is broken.
  • Re-adds the emag bolting doors open and breaking them, instead of just opening them and breaking them. Can't be stopping security because you have a crowbar and they don't, now.
  • Fixes aciding an item so that the moltem item spawns on the turf instead of the loc, and the 'The x melts.' message is broadcasted from the turf. In case we melt a bucket inside of a chemistry dispenser.
  • Adds a sanity check to the nanoui of the chemical dispenser to delete the container var if it's... been deleted... so that we don't try read from a null reagents datum and crash the chemical dispenser for a few minutes.
  • Fixes a typo in the mop bucket code - mobbuckets are, unfortunately, not real. Yet.

Geeves updated:

  • Consular Officer and Corporate Liaison has been split into two separate jobs with their own slots.
  • Lings can now use their armblades to break open welded scrubbers and air vents.

Geeves, Kyres updated:

  • Added a new gamemode, Magistake, where a group of four rookie mages take the skipjack on a joyride to the station.
  • Magical staves now show their ammo on the HUD.
  • Magic missile no longer targets fellow magic users.

The Stryker updated:

  • Adds a sprite for the buckethat that won't clip with tajara ears.

18 September 2020

Ferner updated:

  • Added buttons to hide your character's loadout and/or job clothing in the character preview.

17 September 2020

Aboshehab updated:

  • Ablative armor Energy protection raised from 10 to 40.

Alberyk, Kyres1 updated:

  • Head of personnel's miniature disruptor pistol has been replaced by a regular disruptor pistol.
  • Detective's disruptor pistol has been replaced by a miniature disruptor pistol.
  • Added new icons for the disruptor pistols.

Geeves updated:

  • Diona structures can now be attacked by regular weapons to damage and destroy them.
  • Alien vines have been renamed to biomass vines, and can now be attacked and welded to destroy them.
  • Diona walls now spawn vines when ripped apart, instead of nymphs. It should help with lag when many are erected.
  • Chainsaws now have the correct damage values when powered on.
  • Biomass floors can now be sprayed with plant-b-gone to remove them.

  • Adds a Europan whale bone smoking pipe.

Ferner updated:

  • Apparitions can no longer summon apparitions.
  • Fixed burglars spawning with raider stuff.

FirinMaLazors updated:

  • Makes cutting up fish into sashimi delete the fish.

Geeves updated:

  • You can now open the integrated circuit menu by clicking on your assembly with a multitool.
  • The multitool no longer needs to be in your active hand to work on integrated circuits, but your active hand will take preference.
  • Various HTML UIs have been altered to take style into account, many of them should look better across the board.
  • The station blueprints now has a disorganized colour-coded wiring diagram for vending machines and airlocks.
  • Tank dispensers now apply stylesheets to the UI, so it should look a bit better now.
  • Tank dispensers output tanks into one of your open hands, if possible.

13 September 2020

Ferner updated:

  • The preview window now shows the character closer up, and the backgrounds are now different types of flooring found on Aurora.
  • Fixes tcfl members being unable to access welding closets.
  • Bumped up the rarity of the pulse pistol and gyropistol in the random gun pool.
  • Mechs will now handle their part layering a bit more sanely, fixed the mounted rapidfire blaster being stuck on the wrong firing mode.

  • Changed all instances of R&D Root Beer to RnD Root Beer to avoid NanoUI having a fit when you try to dispense it from the NanoUI.

MoondancerPony updated:

  • Appliances now properly cool down.
  • Chicken nuggets now spawn with reagents.
  • Custom food size prefixes are now in the right place.
  • Custom foods no longer change size after being eaten.
  • Meat buns now use the right appliances.
  • Mixers now actually cook things.
  • Sugar no longer caramelises when you're baking.
  • You no longer get fortune cookies when trying to make pies.
  • Virus food now needs sugar to avoid conflicts with some recipes.
  • Certain containers have been made larger to fix some uncraftable recipes.
  • The check_* procs for recipes now use defines.

11 September 2020

Aboshehab, Stryker, Wowzewow updated:

  • Added a black beret for the Head of Security, courtesy of Stryker. Now found in the loadout and relevant lockers.
  • Added black hats for both the Warden and Head of Security, courtesy of Wowzewow.
  • Added a crowbar and handcuffs to the Head of Security locker.
  • Adjusted the loadout for headwear for both the Warden and Head of Security to be selection based from a list to condense tab size.
  • Hats for the Head of Security and Warden that once had armor values no longer do, becoming regular headwear.

Alberyk updated:

  • Added a door hacker to the ninja tesla hardsuit.
  • Buying a tesla rig as a ninja will now spawn a tesla spine augment injector.

Crosarius, Arrow768 updated:

  • Implements a multi-mode disruptor pistol to the security arsenal. This weapon replaces the security taser and .45 pistol as the primary sidearm of Security Officers and comes with a wireless-control firing pin.
  • Replaces the detective's current ballistic sidearm with a disruptor pistol, and adds a disruptor pistol to the CSI/FT locker for their own protection as well.
  • Replaces the outdated energy pistols belonging to Command staff who have them, the Warden, NT-affiliated Liasions, and ERT Protection Detail with disruptor pistols.
  • Implements a wireless-control restricted firing pin, which by default will only allow weapons to be fired on stun until the alert level is sufficiently elevated. These firing pins can be controlled remotely the firearms control program located on security consoles, provided you have an armory-level access ID.
  • Moves the .45 pistols and rubber .45 magazines from the Security Officer secure lockers to the armoury.

Ferner updated:

  • Antag shuttles now warn the pilot that they cannot return to Aurora if they go back to base.

Geeves updated:

  • Borg drills no longer have an invisible sprite.

Sparky_hotdog updated:

  • Selecting Safety Goggles in loadout preferences now gives you safety goggles, not prescription glasses.

  • RMT now metabolises twice as slowly and overdoses at 40 units (was 20).

  • Updates the targeting algorithm of turrets so they are a bit more difficult.

Geeves, Kyres updated:

  • Research has been given a new pet, Ives, the tame baby harvester hivebot.

Hocka updated:

  • The normal description of thermal aviators is now the same as standard aviators so that they aren't given away so easily.
  • Thermal aviators now have an antag-specific description.

MattAtlas updated:

  • Drinking glasses, wine bottles and such now shatter when thrown.
  • Beakers now properly shatter when thrown as well.
  • Reagent containers should break properly when hit. Be careful when pouring drinks, don't use harm intent.
  • Fixes no-client human pain emotes not working.

Skull132 updated:

  • Reload Admins will now update the admins from the forumsuser API when enabled.
  • admins.txt will now accommodate more complex rank names, specifically ones with spaces and other special characters.

Snakebittenn updated:

  • Rolls a lot of loadout items under selections.
  • Removes fake sunglasses from the loadout.
  • Removes red/purple berets from the loadout.
  • Removes kimono from the loadout.
  • Removes armor values from winter coats.
  • Removes mailman hat from the loadout.
  • Unathi forward demon horns now look right.
  • Fingerless gloves work right again.
  • Orange goggles and science goggles are pickable again.

Sparky_hotdog updated:

  • Fixed the replica katana not having back, belt or in-hand sprites.

Wowzewow (Wezzy) updated:

  • Refactors how button toggling on coats work.
  • You can now unbutton/button your coats while buckled to a chair.
  • Labcoat open/close item states have been aligned.
  • Detective technicolor trenchcoat has been removed for being criminally unused and outclassed by other trenchcoats.
  • Detective technicolor hat has been removed as well for the same reasons.
  • Hastur hood has been removed.
  • Paint buckets have been removed for being practically unused.
  • Sechuds and medhuds should no longer be jumbled up now.
  • Wallets are actually re-colorable now.
  • Flash proof sunglasses have been job restricted again. This is mainly to avoid powergaming issues.
  • Non-flash proof sunglasses have been readded.

03 September 2020

  • Added a generic photo item to the custom loadout.

Ferner updated:

  • Greatly expanded the raider starting clothing/gun variety. They'll now have a chance of getting almost any gun in the game, but don't expect auto-revolvers or nuke launchers every single time.

  • Simple mobs can now be pointblanked instead of whacking them.

Hocka updated:

  • Bluespace turfs no longer emit light.

02 September 2020

Aboshehab updated:

  • Eldritch voidsuit will now properly display the sprite when worn.
  • Updated Lucky Strike to Laissez-Faires for loadout selection.

Code by Geeves, Sprites by Kyres updated:

  • Reduced the damage cult swords do, 25 down from 30.
  • Added some adminspawn cult things.

Ferner updated:

  • Fixed the burglar shuttle getting stuck when docking at blue dock.
  • Fixed an inconsistency with access requirements at the Beta solar array.

Geeves updated:

  • Cargo mechs can no longer spawn with cult mech pieces.

MattAtlas updated:

  • The incapacitation rune should now work properly.

MoondancerPony updated:

  • Overhauls cooking!
  • Recipes can now call for sliced, dried, or sliced and dried fruit.
  • Fixes the issue with plants showing up as labelled with a piece of paper.
  • Fixes a logic error with condiment bottles.
  • Adds new sprites for Adhomian plants.
  • Recipes are now spread out across more files.
  • Seed datums are now spread out across more files and categorised.
  • Adds a new appliance to the kitchen, the stove.
  • Adds bowls and plates, which can be used to create mixing-based recipes, similar to the microwave. Drag it to yourself to finalise a recipe.
  • Adds new flavoring syrups, as well as simple syrup.
  • Adds several new Adhomian foods: Nomad skewers, fatshouter blood pudding, and fermented hma'trra.
  • Adds several new foods from the Jargon Federation: lortl, xuq'qil, zantiri, and qilvo.
  • Adds several new kinds of flavored latte.
  • Adds several new plants from the Jargon Federation: q'lort, guami, eki, and ylpha.
  • Adds three new cooking containers to the kitchen: skillets, saucepans, and pots. All three can be put on the stove.
  • Ports sushi from Baystation.
  • You can smack people with (empty) frying pans on harm intent.
  • Microwaves have been removed.
  • Oil no longer uses a data-based temperature system; instead it works like any other reagent.
  • Sandwiches can no longer contain glass shards, in preparation for an upcoming rework/expansion.
  • A lot of recipes have changed.
  • Appliances can now hold multiple types of cooking containers; this is currently only used by the stove.
  • Appliances now heat reagents in cooking containers.
  • Changes the pumpkin spice latte recipes to use pumpkin spice flavoring syrup.
  • Preheating appliances takes much less time.
  • Toggle the power of appliances and change their temperature with control-click.
  • Tray sounds now get chosen randomly (except for gun jams).
  • You can now set the temperature of appliances.
  • Readds the recipes for diona stew and diona soup.

Wowzewow (Wezzy) updated:

  • Readds sounds for sealing and unsealing Rig modules.
  • Fixes shading and missing inhands for high skirt. Adds skater skirt and tube skirt.
  • Some clothes have been replaced. Namely, the green dress, pink dress, dark red dress, crop dress, crop top and blue dress.
  • Accessories replaced are the red ribbon, pink pins, and white ribbon. Check your loadout to re-make them.
  • Beanies and some accessories have been resprited.
  • Adds cropped shirts and dress shirts, as well as a blouse.
  • Magnet pins are now colorable.

01 September 2020

Geeves updated:

  • Implements Crystal Agitators, machines that agitate asteroid turf to form chemical crystals. Check the communal out.
  • You can now dump the contents of a storage item into a disposal bin, by clicking on it on any intent other than harm. Doing so on harm will place the storage item in too.
  • Shaft miners now start with a mining coin that can be redeemed at a mining vendor to get enhanced equipment, such as a starter hand-held mining drill or an upgraded power converter, instead of spawning with a non-functional upgrade in a toolbox.
  • Mech clamps can now be used to force open airlocks and firedoors. Welding and bolting affects how long it will take and how loud the action will be.

Hocka updated:

  • Windoors can no longer be obnoxiously spammed to open them.
  • Fixed the compressed matter implanter trying to scan it's own implant when trying to put it back in.
  • Items that were canned by a compressed matter implanter can now be returned by activating the implanter in hand and using a screwdriver on the implant.
  • The compressed matter implant listing on the uplink now has a more accurate description for retrieving scanned items.

MattAtlas updated:

  • Vending machine sounds now actually work.

Sparky_Hotdog updated:

  • All medical and security HUDs now display records on examining.

The Stryker updated:

  • Earther and Europan accents added to all IPC subspecies.

Wowzewow (Wezzy) updated:

  • Hoodie/Wintercoat hoods should render properly above masks, glasses and other accessories. Go wear a balaclava with a hoodie, why won't you?

kermit updated:

  • The majority of medicinal chemicals have added side-effects - nothing too disruptive.
  • Added a variety of overdoses to chemicals that were lacking overdoses.
  • Some medications now contraindicate one another and should not be taken together.
  • Certain chemicals have been totally overhauled to make them more unique or enjoyable to use.
  • Overdoses are now triggered by volume in the blood and by a small metabolised dose of the drug (defaulting to 5 units).
  • The default OD threshold is now 20u. Poor communication between doctors is now more likely to result in ODs.
  • Alkysine and Cataleptinol will now actually heal the brain at varying rates, as opposed to both treating the same amount of low damage.
  • The default chemical transfer rates of RIG injectors, Medibots and bottles have been reduced to allow more precise dose measurements.
  • More medical chemicals will appear on medical scans as opposed to being registered as unknown substances.
  • Introducing Butazoline, the dermaline equivalent for treating brute injuries. It cannot treat arterial bleeding like Bicaridine, however.
  • Saline is now the chief blood restorative medication and only works intravenously at a medium transfer rate.
  • Iron/Copper/Sulphur pills now restore blood at half their previous rate.
  • Any combination of mortaphenyl, oxycormorphine and alcholic beverages will be dangerous. Don't mix them.
  • Dexalin Plus overdoses are now extra toxic to vaurcae - too much oxygen for their gas exchange system to handle at a time.
  • Soy Sauce is now made with salt instead of sulphuric acid.
  • Brute First-Aid Kits have had their contents shuffled about to include a health analyser and 2 bicaridine pills.
  • Added Mercury, Neurapan and Spectrocybin to the random toxins list which can spawn in maintenance or a traitor toxin kit.
  • You can now purchase Sideeffect-Be-Gone autoinjectors from the Traitor Uplink. Combat Medical Kits also contain 1 of these autoinjectors.
  • Pill bottles which spawn at round-start and in kits now have the dosage of the pills on the label to prevent accidental overdoses.
  • Some chemical typos have been fixed. Uncapitalised chemicals have been capitalised.
  • You can find all of the chemical changes on the feedback thread (https://forums.aurorastation.org/topic/14761-full-chem-rework-feedback-thread/) while the chemistry wiki page is out of date.

31 August 2020

MoondancerPony updated:

  • Blindstrike no longer adds confusion to synthetics, pending a confusion rework.
  • Fixes the Beepsky Smash recipe.
  • 9mm flash magazines are labelled as such.

NiennaB, The Stryker updated:

  • Added Dominian Diona, Trinary Perfection, Zavodskoi, and Idris flags.
  • Changed the colorable trenchcoat sprite.
  • Added existing Hephaestus and Zeng-Hu flags to the loadout.

Snakebittenn updated:

  • Tapping someone no longer metagames their gender.
  • Psychic ping now properly checks for psi augs.

The Stryker, NewOriginalSchwann updated:

  • Added Europan, Deep Frontier, and Earther accents. Descriptions done by Schwann.

30 August 2020

Geeves updated:

  • Blank Vaurca Drones ordered from cargo now start with an active filter port, meaning they won't immediately start suffocating.
  • Blank Vaurca Drones now start with the correct hive colour.
  • C'thur is now one of the possible randomly generated hive names.

Hocka updated:

  • Emagged airlocks can now be closed with a crowbar and repaired like a regular broken airlock.
  • Emagged windoors no longer spawn two airlock electronics.
  • Airlock electronics pried out from emagged windoors are now actually broken instead of being fully functional electronics with the broke icon state tacked on.
  • Emagged windoors are now identified by a description text saying it is jammed.
  • Using a crowbar on an emagged airlock now dismantles it, returning five reinforced glass sheets instead of shattering it.
  • Fully shattering a windoor now destroys the airlock electronics inside instead of spitting out a fully intact board.

Snakebittenn updated:

  • Makes M'sai ears longer.

29 August 2020

Aboshehab updated:

  • Returns the human and synthetic screen images to rotation.

Ferner updated:

  • Added some new, faction specific stamps, some corporate liaisons and consular representatives spawn with them.
  • Chameleon stamps now have a rename function, incase you need to fake the authority of a smaller faction that doesn't have an official stamp design(yet).
  • Chameleon stamps now exclude fluff/custom item stamps from their selection.

Goret updated:

  • The inhand sprite of the butcher's cleaver is back.

MattAtlas updated:

  • Diona nymph death period before being inhabited is now twice as long, actually allowing people to get into them.
  • Removed a useless, nonfunctional admin secret.
  • Borgs can now pick up slime positions.
  • AIs can no longer use mechs while unwrenched.
  • The wristbound computer sprite can now be switched in the ID slot.
  • Expedition shotguns now have proper directional sprites.
  • Blind talismans now actually work.
  • Synthskin limbs now match the mob's color.
  • Mech wreckages can now properly be scavenged with a welding tool and wrench.
  • MMIs and robot boards can no longer be used as IPC brains.
  • Armblades now properly play the blade sound.
  • Trinary perfection antenna now also renders on the ear.
  • Simple mobs such as cult constructs can now target and hit specific limbs.
  • Applying pressure to your wounds no longer ignores species blood color when bloodying your hands.

Wowzewow (Wezzy) updated:

  • Fixes drone hatches on airlocks. Finally.

mikomyazaki updated:

  • Inherent spells are now properly removed when you change species away from that species, e.g. when Golems would change using a plastic surgery machine.

28 August 2020

Alberyk updated:

  • Mining borgs should now have access to a scanner pda to find ores.
  • Added dionae bites to the snack vending machine.

Geeves updated:

  • Diona take less pain damage from lack of light.
  • Diona now take 50% the usual pain damage, down from 70%.
  • General pain messages now have a 5 second delay between them to prevent spam.
  • Diona can now feel which organ of theirs are damaged, instead of pointing to the parent organ.
  • Psychokinetic tools have been given new sprites. Changing what it's emulating has now been given a radial menu.
  • Psychokinetic tools, psi-blades, and telekinetic grabs now properly delete when dropped or thrown.
  • Psi-tools now do slightly more damage, 5, up from 1.
  • Certain cargo items, such as protohumans, now arrive in bodybags instead of crates.
  • Cargo containers now arrive labeled, which allows you to take the label off. The paper inside the container will still hold the owner's info.
  • It is now possible to create new records in authorized record programs again.

MattAtlas updated:

  • Refactored backend group sound picking.
  • Some sounds that didn't work before should work now.

WilliamMurdoch updated:

  • Fixes IPC positronic brains to now display names properly.
  • Research robots can now pick up exosuit remote control chips with their gripper.

mikomyazaki updated:

  • Pulling structures, e.g. chairs, lockers will now cause some slowdown. To prevent people circumventing the slowdown from pulling a slow mob by putting them inside something first. Roller beds & Wheelchairs are exempt from this.

27 August 2020

WilliamMurdoch updated:

  • Allows any object with a flame to burn flags.

26 August 2020

Alberyk updated:

  • Fixed being unable to dismantle girders and other structures.

Doxxmedearly updated:

  • Drone anti-theft now just gibs them instead of causing a small explosion.

Ferner updated:

  • Fixed ghostspawners sometimes spawning humans with broken bones.
  • Fixed the random weapon with ammo uplink option spawning the wrong amounts/kinds of ammo occasionally.

MattAtlas updated:

  • Glass of.. what? renamed to glass of something. The sprite is also now white instead of brown.
  • Dispensers of all kinds now eject items to your hands.
  • Rags no longer put water in reagent containers. Also generalized wipedown functionality so it can be overridden by atoms.
  • Reagents will no longer display lukewarm when drank.

MattAtlas, Carpe Venenum updated:

  • Most drink bottles have new lore-related names and descriptions, including fluff descriptions, all written by Carpe Venenum. Check them out!

Skull132 updated:

  • Newscasters should no longer attempt to kill the server with timers.
  • Remote control of vents and scrubbers may be a bit less responsive.

Wowzewow (Wezzy) updated:

  • Adds onmob and item sprites for wristbound computers.

kyres1 updated:

  • Added title screens for an ongoing lore arc.

mikomyazaki updated:

  • The randomized vending machines in the Raider base will now be always accessible by the raiders.

25 August 2020

Doxxmedearly updated:

  • Non-traitor AI and stationbounds can no longer disable airlock safeties. They can re-enable them if they are off and the wire isn't cut.

Geeves updated:

  • Comfy chairs and office chairs will now deconstruct into the same amount of material used to create them.
  • Cloth, leather, and carpet now properly deconstruct into their stack types.
  • Cloth, leather, carpet, and cotton no longer have good blunt and edge damages.
  • Deconstructed materials now neatly pack into one stack instead of spawning multiple stacks of one.
  • Tweaked the deconstruction of various structures. They will likely drop more material now.
  • Material crafting windows now have a back button when you're in a sub-list.

MoondancerPony updated:

  • Pronouns should now reflect what someone is wearing more accurately.
  • Properly unifies flag_inv to use one set of non-overlapping bitflags.
  • Fixes gender not updating correctly on change.
  • Fixes pronouns not showing up.
  • Makes it so exposing either your chest or lower body un-conceals pronouns, as opposed to needing both.

24 August 2020

Alberyk updated:

  • Remote virtual reality centres should no longer work while on unpowered areas.
  • Removed mesons and material scanners from the station.
  • Safety goggles now protects from supermatter hallucinations.

Chada1 updated:

  • In general dropped the prices of Medical TC items by a ton, we really shouldn't be price gouging healing for Antags when they already have the deck stacked against them.

Doxxmedearly updated:

  • Pneumalin and adipemcina now properly heal organ damage.

Ferner updated:

  • Fixed players sometimes spawning with ashy feet.
  • Fixed a few lighting issues and things related to shuttles.
  • Landing back on the asteroid after falling into space now makes you take fall damage again, watch your step out there.

Ferner, TheDocOct updated:

  • Added a new asteroid dungeon template by TheDocOct.
  • Tweaked the contents of some dungeon templates.

MattAtlas updated:

  • You can no longer slap things that aren't adjacent to you.
  • You can now only slap mobs.

Wowzewow (Wezzy) updated:

  • Adds new push sounds, fixes punch sounds not using the proper path in sound.dm.

mikomyazaki updated:

  • The Merchant's button to allow a Merchant's Assistant to spawn will now display the correct buttons on its UI.

23 August 2020

mikomyazaki updated:

  • Fixes issue where the SM would try to animate the pointing filter, causing graphical lag.

22 August 2020

Alberyk, Kyres1 updated:

  • Added most of the stuff seen during the Bad Moon on the Rise arc to the game: adhomian automatic rifles, adhomian muskets, knife-revolver and sham'tyr.

Wowzewow (Wezzy) updated:

  • Adds new generic pickup and drop sounds.
  • New sounds for using bottles as a weapon.
  • Adds new ambience sounds.
  • New sound for votes starting.

mikomyazaki updated:

  • Prevents mapping multiple turfs per tile.
  • The 'who' verb list is now sorted by ckey. Also moved total count to the top.
  • Players who are given roles restricted from an antag role they were selected for will now be removed from that role's candidate list - This may result in a game mode reset due to lack of antagonists, but it will prevent the mode spawning with too few antagonists.
  • Special symbols ' and - will no longer automatically capitalize the following character, this was affecting names mostly.
  • Independent Liaisons no longer have species restrictions.

21 August 2020

Alberyk updated:

  • Fixed the canned fatshouters meat's can having the wrong sprite after it was eaten.

Alberyk, Kyres1 updated:

  • Added phoron eating worms.

Burrito Justice and Nienna updated:

  • Added body markings for the G1, G2, Bishop, Zeng-Hu, and Xion IPC frames to be colored and customized.
  • The G2 sprite has been updated to give it a fresher look, courtesy of Nienna.
  • Changed how species are checked in the code. It now requires the full type path of the species datum, instead of the bodytype.

Ferner updated:

  • Fixed holodeck swords lacking icons and being named 'Item', fixed some misc leftover stuff on the centcomm level.

Geeves updated:

  • Lyodsuit masks now act as a breath mask, but it's really bad at filtration if not hooked up to a tank.
  • Lyodsuit masks can now be rolled up to reveal your face.
  • Lyodsuit hoodies' mask toggling is now an action button as well as a right click verb.
  • Fixed lyodsuit hoodies' sprites being janky.

Wowzewow (Wezzy) updated:

  • Fixes mop not updating inhands when wet.

mikomyazaki updated:

  • Research can now access and download the Chemistry Codex that is installed on the Research wrist computers.
  • Air alarms sensor settings works properly again.
  • Destroyed canisters no longer emit light.
  • Can now pass dislodged girders properly when they are opened.
  • You can now sample blood inside containers (like bottles, beakers) using a swab.

Arrow768 updated:

  • Kitchen condiments are now named properly again.

  • Fixes condi-master not properly using container names for certain reagents. Rejoice, for your flour sacks are no longer called flour bottles.
  • Coldsauce is blue now.
  • You can no longer stuff pill bottles in the condi-master. Doesn't matter, since you couldn't make pills in the first place.

  • Any type of wirecutter can now be used to carve a bucket into a hat.

19 August 2020

Chada updated:

  • Made both the rev teams have more members at round start, and a much higher attempted number. This also made it necessary to up the pop requirement for the gamemode. Probably for the better, too.

Ferner, Stryker updated:

  • Remapped the antagonist bases, they're now compressed and in closer proximity together with some added theme. Compressed BLV The Tower a bit, removing the unused hangar, tweaked most other shuttles.
  • Changed around the emergency services dock a bit, allowing for additional shuttles to dock there, including the distress team one.
  • Facelifted the arrivals spawnpoint to leave a better first impression on newcomers, tweaked the ccia shuttle hangar to look a little more fancy.
  • Some shuttles now have additional landing spots. Added two new bluespace beacons, that ninjas can start at.
  • Added a carriable republic of biesel flag that the tclf can carry into battle if they so wish, added some species specific versions of the standard legion helmet. (Spriting by Stryker)
  • Re-added a functional version of the merc elite shuttle, for use in events, admin shenaginans and the like.
  • The burglar pen no longer works on admin z-levels.
  • Fixes a whole load of issues related to the centcom z-level, overlaps, non-functioning buttons, edges and other ugly stuff.
  • Unusual containers now have a slightly larger spritepool.

MattAtlas, MikoMyazaki2 updated:

  • Lasers no longer do organ damage.
  • Armor blocking is now fully percentage based. No more random 100% blocks.
  • Brain damage from bloodloss is now much slower.
  • Lungs now have slightly more health.

  • Added some cardboard to the kitchen supply locker.

16 August 2020

Hocka updated:

  • If you pull a human mob who's slowdown is greater than yours your speed will slow down to match them.
  • Adds three Vaurca-specific accents: Zo'rane, K'laxane and C'thuric.
  • Vaurca no longer have access to the Biesel accent by default, instead it is replaced by TTS.

  • Speed of IPC baseline screen animations decreased by adding new frames.
  • Tweaked several baseline screens (static, static2, breakout, monoeye, RGB).
