  • Turret controls should now work with turrets correctly once again.

05 November 2017

Chaoko99 updated:

  • Hopefully removes all uses of the 'Red Cross' to avoid committing victimless war crimes. Please report any uses that were missed. To Devs: If you get an error mentioning a missing type path of '/obj/structure/sign/redcross', replace it with '/obj/structure/sign/greencross'

Karolis2011 updated:

  • Modular computers can no longer download programs that can't actually run on them.

Printer16 updated:

  • You can now reboot maintenance drones.
  • Universal recorder transcripts are now printed into your hand.
  • Added a stop all sounds verb located in the OOC tab.
  • Shredding ID cards no longer generates paper.
  • Borgs can now fill up buckets/beakers/other containers by using the sink.
  • The AI help menu has been updated.
  • Updated the NanoUI map.
  • Medbots no longer try to heal IPCs.

30 October 2017

Alberyk updated:

  • Removed mixed secret from the voting options, all mixed gamemodes should be added to the regular secret rotation.

29 October 2017

Skull132 updated:

  • Sleepers will no longer jettison their stored components when you exit them.
  • Vampires approaching frenzy will now get their appropriate messages again.
  • For vampires: capped the maximum time you can accumulate for frenzy. And having more blood will now reduce frenzy faster: the more humans you succ dry, the faster you become human again!
  • Fixed a runtime in robot/put_in_hands, which bugged out numerous gripper interactions. To include building robots as a science borg.
  • Toxins can now be added to the pathogenic dish incubator again.
  • Robotic eyes (not assisted ones!) are now partially immune to pepperspray effects. Because robots.
  • Death timers no longer reset if you re-enter your corpse.
  • Holocall fixes: icons are generated properly, caller view is moved properly, icons are cleaned up properly, AI interaction is now fine.
  • Added a second lobby screen, courtesy of NursieKitty and Zelm.
  • Wizards can no longer upgrade spacebats into an instant-summon. The ability to spam mobs is bad ju-ju.

28 October 2017

Alberyk updated:

  • Blood heal should now fix broken bones and internal bleeding.

Chaoko99 updated:

  • Fixed Tesla Balls never deleting themselves.
  • Corrected the Anomaly Core description, added some clarification of its use.

TheGreatJorge updated:

  • Blast doors should now be properly oriented.
  • Fixes APC overlays.
  • Xenoarcheology now has one portable ladder and hoist kit available at the excavation site rack.

24 October 2017

Lohikar updated:

  • Shadows no longer mysteriously hang around after building or destroying walls.
  • IPCs no longer have organic (right) legs. We're not really sure how they got them, and we don't want to know.
  • The sprint indicator now actually works for IPCs, as well as updating immediately when toggled by a species with stamina.

22 October 2017

Skull132 updated:

  • Hull and bubble shields now work as expected once more.

20 October 2017

Lohikar updated:

  • Parallax preferences now actually get loaded, because apparently that's important or something.
  • Shuttles should now longer get mysterious square shadows.

MoondancerPony updated:

  • Memory chips will no longer automatically overwrite themselves to whatever their outputs are connected to, and will now output properly. An engineer seems to have installed the chip backwards inside the casing. NanoTrasen apologises for this lapse in service.
  • Locators and other scanning devices now properly push data to other devices.
  • Basic pathfinders will now stop moving if they cannot see their target, instead of jamming.

15 October 2017

AgentWhatever updated:

  • After a very long and elaborate process, we have finally learned our new announcement system that the location of certain objects beamed onto the station is, in fact, known. You are welcome

Alberyk updated:

  • Removed cult word research, cultists can use their runes without having to find out the meanings.
  • Ghosts have more influence upon the material plane during cult rounds.
  • Manifested ghosts can't be used to summon Nar'sie anymore.
  • The null is more powerful against the forces of the paranormal now.
  • Added a new bag option; messenger bags.
  • The telebaton stun should not longer ignore the target's armor.
  • Ported the baystation12 merchant jobs, with additions and proper modifications.
  • Added new cleric wizard spells.
  • Summon bear and summon bats should be a bit more powerful.
  • You can now only use transformation sting on bodies.
  • Added dice to the custom loadout.
  • Replaced the combat module plasma cutter with a new melee weapon.
  • Fixed traitor cyborgs not being emmaged whens selected as traitors.
  • Fixed the syndicate borg's emag not working as it should.
  • Bees damage should be less deadly now.
  • Added new immersive pool mechanics.
  • Added new sounds to certain items and actions.
  • Added new sounds to some cult runes.
  • Cultists can not accept wizard contracts anymore.
  • Added new food recipes.
  • You can now pick up corgis.
  • IPCs, dionae and other races that could not suffer oxygen damage, should be able to succumb now.
  • Added a tajara language; Ya'ssa.
  • Changed the default occupation's preference to return to lobby if you do not get the job you want.
  • Revolutionaries and loyalists now have access to a device that can create a single central command report.

Arrow768 updated:

  • Cargo is now based on credits instead of points.
  • Adds more mixed modes (feeding, infiltration, paranormal).
  • Halfs the blood required for diseased touch.
  • Added a button to call the emergency shuttle.
  • It is no longer possible to call the shuttle using the command console.

BRAINOS updated:

  • Completely resprited prosthetic limbs with all new sprites for Bishop, Xion, Hephaestus and Zeng-Hu. The first three are a major step forward in quality, while Zeng-Hu's limbs are entirely re-imagined as something new!

Belsima updated:

  • Replaced ATM, requisition, and some other consoles with old holographic sprites.

Chaoko99 updated:

  • Nitrous Oxide is an oxidizer.
  • Replaced the old [CAUTION] Canister with a cleaner sprite.
  • Added a hazard stripe overlay for people to add to new canister sprites in DM.
  • Nerfed space bear speed, damage.
  • Parallax dust now defaults to on.
  • Replaced the energy sword and double saber sprites with those from /TG/.
  • Gravity generator has lights now.
  • Singularity cannot eat ore overlays anymore, they will be destroyed alongside their respective asteroid wall.
  • Replaced our RPED sprite with /TG/'s, and added a little animation atop that.
  • Added a special bag for slime cores. Credit to Virgo for the sprite.
  • Hastens slime-core extraction surgery slightly.

Ezuo updated:

  • Added a box in the chaplain's office that allows them to select from a null rod, staff, or athame.

HetNeSS updated:

  • Added a GPS tool to rescue cyborg module pack and a mining drill to construction borg module pack

Juani2400 updated:

  • Remapped: Atmospherics, Captain's Office, Heads of Staff Conference Room, CMO's office, Medical Briefing Room, Security Processing and Holding Cell.
  • Modified: Robotics Laboratory.
  • Mapped in the desk ringers.
  • Added a new subtype of folder: Security.
  • Added new flooring decals for Medical.
  • Started the re-work of map areas. Most areas have been renamed as a result. More changes to be done eventually.

Karolis2011 updated:

  • Replaced command and communications console with modular console

Lohikar updated:

  • Added some subtle shadow effects to walls and open spaces that should make them stand out more.
  • ChemMasters will now default to transfer-to-beaker instead of transfer-to-disposal.
  • Welding and disassembling lockers now takes 2 seconds instead of being instantaneous.
  • Escaping welded lockers now shows a progress bar to the escapee if Progress Bars are enabled in your global preferences.
  • Made some sanity check messages more clear as to why an object cannot be interacted with.
  • The Bluespace Bears / Bioweapons event has been removed.
  • NT is proud to announce general availability of modular electronics kits for Research and Engineering departments galaxy-wide, batteries not included. (Ported from Polaris)
  • Implants now actually fit back in the implanter that they were removed from.
  • Round duration is now actually the duration of the round, instead of time passed since last server reboot.
  • Elevators now have elevator music.
  • APCs now have west/east icon states.
  • Fire alarms should no longer have inconsistent offsets on walls.
  • Guest ID cards' icons will now change when they expire.
  • Removed some extra pixels in some voidsuit helmets' item light overlay.
  • Preferences setup will now tell you if you try to add body markings to a species that has none available.
  • Admin revive will now restore body markings and round-start prosthetics.
  • Wires can now be placed on catwalks in space.
  • Two new icon scaling sizes have been added to the Icons menu: 96x and 128x.
  • Stairs now actually work. Not that there is any.
  • Walking off the side of (real) stairs will now cause you to faceplant on the ground.
  • Multi-tile doors' icons should now work properly with open spaces.
  • Sprinting stamina now has a bar showing your remaining stamina instead of coloring the sprint button.
  • Replaced our ancient wall sprites with a slightly tweaked fancy one from Europa.

MoondancerPony updated:

  • You can now print device cells from the protolathe or mechatronic fabricator for use in integrated electronics.
  • Damage overlays now update on their own. You can stop punching IPCs and shells to fix their faces, now, Lualyrr.
  • Shells now have their own face repair surgery. Use it when they're showing up as Unknown. The steps are: Scalpel, Multitool/Cable Coil, Retractor/Wirecutters, Cautery.

Pacmandevil updated:

  • Whenever you shoot someone while aiming at them, the aim is Dropped
  • There is now a cooldown to re-aiming after you shoot, this is currently 3 seconds.
  • A few more Emotes. try to not slap yourselves too much.

Printer16 updated:

  • Deconstructing book cases now gives the proper type of wood.
  • You will now receive a message when implanted with a loyalty implant.
  • Added a new code: Code Yellow. This is used for biological threats (IE. carp or space vines) and does not allow security to search without a warrant.
  • The crusher is no longer safe to use while operational.
  • Added a drop pod.
  • The gravity generator was added back.
  • Ported holocalls.
  • Added a limit to the mining vendor.
  • The floodlight was changed to come on the shuttle when bought from the mining vendor.
  • You can now upgrade sleepers, cooking appliances, tesla coils and the ore processer.
  • Beakers now show a message if they have solids inside.
  • Added an accuracy rating to containers. Containers will only tell you how many units of chemicals there are according to how accurate they are.
  • Admins can now replace people using the 'replace player with ghost' option in the secrets tab.
  • You can now view the probability of each gamemode using the check gamemode probability verb.

Scheveningen updated:

  • Adds a dispersion effect to the thermal drill.
  • Tentatively buffs laser damage types across the board and makes other adjustments to their overall impact.
  • Reduces laser rifle maximum capacity to 15 (down from 20). It is a change to make it less oppressive.

SoundScopes updated:

  • Can no longer point at things using alt+rightclick due to hacky code

wraithcraft updated:

  • Added Champagne, Mint Syrup and Bitters. (Now avaliable in your local booze-o-mat)
  • Added Champagne to the booze dispenser.
  • Added 11 new (moderately thought out) cocktails.

13 October 2017

Alberyk updated:

  • Fixed two AIs spawning during paranoia.

Belsima updated:

  • Microwaves can now be cleaned with soap.

MoondancerPony updated:

  • Telescience now starts with 3 crystals again.
  • Telescience can now go up to 5 crystals instead of just 4.
  • The default Z-level for the telescience console is now the level it's actually on.

17 September 2017

Skull132 updated:

  • CCIAA now have full access to AOOC, as per the decree of the Head Admins.

14 September 2017

Lohikar updated:

  • Orange security consoles have had their red lights swapped out for orange ones. No longer will your orange holoconsole mysteriously glow red.
  • Space vines should no longer create comical amounts of lag.

MoondancerPony updated:

  • Made eye color selection work in character setup.

09 September 2017

Ezuo updated:

  • Fixed the long broken Lawgiver code. It will now function as intended, with different firemodes using different charge values.

06 September 2017

Skull132 updated:

  • Cameras will no longer lag the server to death whenever you click to jump to a turf that's outside the station.

05 September 2017

Lohikar updated:

  • Storage code has been tweaked so ore bags should no longer take multiple seconds to fill/empty.
  • The ore summoner should actually transport useful amounts of ore now.

27 August 2017

Printer16 updated:

  • Hunter killers can repair themselves now.

23 August 2017

Lohikar updated:

  • Nursing Intern has been renamed to Medical Resident.

15 August 2017

Lohikar updated:

  • Vaurca now have two hearts and one set of lungs as was originally intended instead of three hearts and two sets of lungs.

13 August 2017

Lohikar updated:

  • Crayons now have range sanity checks.
  • Cryopods no longer act as impromptu teleportation devices.
  • Fixed a bug which caused space parallax to always be static, regardless of preferences.

07 August 2017

Lohikar updated:

  • Fixed a visual inconsistency where airlock hatches & maint panel overlays would draw over the opening animation when they shouldn't have.

05 August 2017

Alberyk updated:

  • Changed the uprising gamemode to be revolution and traitor, instead of revolution and cult.

04 August 2017

Lohikar updated:

  • Elevators now use small lights instead of tube lights.
  • Lights will no longer mysteriously float in mid-air in elevator shafts.

03 August 2017

Skull132 updated:

  • Genetics has been removed again.

02 August 2017

Lohikar updated:

  • Tesla coils now actually work without requiring server staff intervention.
  • Fixed a bug where orbits (such as the Tesla) didn't animate as they were intended to.

31 July 2017

Lohikar updated:

  • Progress bars will now stack instead of obscuring each other when you are doing multiple things at once.
  • NanoTrasen Autodrobe(tm) units have received a firmware update and should no longer steal your clothes. NanoTrasen apologises for any inconveniences caused by showing up to your workplace in the nude.
  • Fixed an issue where objects could not be seen in holes in some rare cases.

27 July 2017

Lohikar updated:

  • The nuke no longer destroys CC if detonated on the station.
  • You should no longer make footstep sounds when being dragged around or when dead.
  • A manufacturing defect has been identified in airlock control mainboards that caused field-programmed boards to ignore configured access restrictions. NanoTrasen is not responsible for any loss of property caused by defective airlocks.

25 July 2017

MoondancerPony updated:

  • Added a recipe for Cafe Melange, black coffee and cream.
  • Cargo can now order premium coffee beans and Morning Glory Coffee Mates. This addition sponsored by Morning Glory Coffee.
  • The recipe for Cafe Au Lait actually works now.

24 July 2017

Lohikar updated:

  • Ghosts are no longer sideways.

23 July 2017

Lohikar updated:

  • Hopefully fixed a bug where markings would not show in certain cases.
  • Fixed a bug where ghosts would find their inner nudist upon death.
  • Reduced openturfs' darkening factor a bit: below objects should be easier to see now.
  • You can now examine human-types and other objects with complex examine behavior through openturfs.
  • Fixed a bug where sometimes openturfs would look strange after a nearby lighting update.

Skull132 updated:

  • Fixes the lobotomy surgery running whenever you try to create chest-cavities.
  • You can now put mining flags/beacons into your backpack after using them again.
  • Thralls can now be embraced, as was intended.
  • Ore magnets will no longer cause hilarious amounts of lag.
  • Unbuckling yourself from a hoist clamp will no longer render the hoist kit unusable.
  • The hoist clamp should now appear over whatever object it's clipped to while said object is clipped to it. It'll reset after unhooking.

21 July 2017

Alberyk updated:

  • Changed how overdoses works, instead of triggered the affect after the reagents are processed, the overdose effect will now happen after the total dose is above the threshold.
  • Reduced the damage caused by dermaline, dylovene, kelotane, dexalin and tricordrazine overdoses.

Skull132 updated:

  • Fixes custom loadouts and role preferences not loading properly on initial character load.
  • NanoTrasen relation is now properly saved and loaded.
  • You can now cancel out of adjusting amputated/proshetic limbs properly.
  • Default cyborg module flavour text now saves properly.

20 July 2017

Lohikar updated:

  • The 'Gutter' language has been renamed to 'Freespeak' for lore reasons.

Skull132 updated:

  • I caved and made the spam filter actually work. It should no longer mute you for empty strings that are worthless.
  • Added language validation. It was previously possible to enter the game as a character with languages you weren't supposed to access. These are now properly purged as necessary.

18 July 2017

AgentWhatever updated:

  • We now have 4 different ways to pronounce fungi. Damn you people complaining
  • All borgs now have eyes indicating if they are alive or not

16 July 2017

AgentWhatever updated:

  • By default, borgs can now understand sign, gutter, tajara sign, Siik Tajr and Azaziba
  • Clerical and syndie borgs can now speak in more tongues
  • Swapped basic and default/classic icons of all modules
  • Fixed the eyes of the heavy science borg when looking west
  • L and R now shows on every possible hud target selection.
  • Funjy does not exist anymore. Say hello to fun guy(fungi) from our new announcement system
  • The announcement system voice got an upgrade. Including steps on how to create more
  • The siren is much more alarming now
  • Bye bye bosun-whistle night mode, hello slightly annoying chime
  • Fixed two borg eye sprites never showing because of typos and another basic icon not showing

Alberyk updated:

  • Changed the tajara random name generator to use more lore friendly names.
  • Improvised firearms failure chances should be more unpredictable now.
  • Added some new guns sprites.
  • Added more options to the custom loadout.
  • Added more alien sprites for hardsuits.
  • Lichdom will now create a phylactery that is necessary for the wizard's resurrection.
  • Dylovene and tricordrazine now have an overdose threshold.
  • Kelotane, dermaline, bicaridine and dexalin overdoses are more dangerous now.
  • Plant-B-Gone should be a bit more damaging to dionae.
  • You can now destroy violins.
  • Added more sounds to certain actions and guns.
  • Added a body marking system, ported from Polaris.
  • Ported baystation 12 preview character system.
  • Added a new changeling power, horror form.
  • Added new changeling related sounds.
  • Ported a taste system from baystation12.
  • Removed the ipc brute reduction, since robotic limbs have them by default, also reduced the brute reduction of industrial ipcs.
  • Fixed shells and industrial's head not being marked as vital parts of their bodies.
  • Ports baystation12 armor system: Armor now has a chance to either block an attack or absorb a fixed portion of damage, instead of randomly blocking either nothing, half, or full damage.
  • Added more hairstyles, ported from baystation.

Arrow768 updated:

  • Fixed wrong message being displayed when items are restocked into vending machines
  • Fixed warrants not being removed from the warrant projector
  • Fixed AI not seeing borg cams
  • Fixed random antag during extended
  • Automates the announcement of CCIA General Notices to raise crew awareness for them
  • Service borgs can use cooking containers with their gripper.
  • Medial Borg Hypospray: Replaces Sleeptoxin with Tramadol
  • Added the crusher.
  • Synthetics are no longer able to authorize warrants.
  • Removed the bootknive from custom loadouts.
  • Added crowbars to the borg modules that were missing them.
  • Removed the flashbangs from the lockers and the security vending machine
  • Warden access is now required to access the armory
  • Removed the .45s from the armory
  • Officer lockers now contain a .45
  • Added cadet lockers with their essential gear
  • Properly named the cadet uniform
  • There are now 4 officer and 2 cadet lockers

Fire and Glory updated:

  • Adjusted the Kneebreaker Hammer's throwing mechanics, it can be thrown through the air faster, it no longer instantly kills people when shot out of a cannon.
  • The Tajaran variant of the AMI has been modified following complaints of their feet being 'literrrally not shaped for the boots'.
  • The Unathi stealth rig looks a little less like a ninja suit and a bit more like the stealth rig. (didn't have the heart to do the Tajarn&Skrell rigs)
  • All Tajaran ERT helmets no longer permit the edge of the Tajaran's face to poke out of the helmet.
  • The skin of the wearer will no longer poke through the Unathi ninja suit.
  • Other, more low-profile changes have been made to various alien RIGsuits.
  • Punted puppies.
  • Stopped the Tajaran and Unathi Industrial RIG helmets from covering the suit's shoulder pads when deployed
  • Ivan the carp is invading your arcades and cargo warehouse.
  • Stopped the Tajaran industrial RIG chestpiece from obscuring the cat's mouth when he looks south with no helmet.
  • With any luck, stopped cigarettes from phasing in and out of existence when held. Tell me directly if this keeps being a thing.
  • Even if you hide a brick in your chin like Skull132, you shouldn't expose it to space, the paramedic Rescue RIG has been modified to reflect this.

HetNeSS updated:

  • Added an autopsy scanner to mediborg; a t-ray scanner, an air analyzer, a lightreplacer, a floor painter, and an inflatable dispenser to a construction borg; Added a wood and a plastic synthesizers to an engineering borg. Engineering borgs can now produce a wooden, white, dark and a freezer floor tiles. Security borgs are now equipped with a book of space laws. Janiborgs did receive a bucket and a matter decomplier. Service borgs did receive a bar of soap and a rag. Mining-related cyborgs now are equipped with a GPS tool.
  • Re-counted a value of an internal metal, plasteel, glass and wire storage of construction, engineering borgs and a maintenance drone.

Lohikar updated:

  • Removed butanol from the chemistry dispenser as it wasn't actually used for anything.
  • Ported another server's implementation of /vg/'s holomaps.
  • NanoTrasen's equipment division has aquired more efficient ovens and fryers. Engineering departments galaxy-wide celebrate.
  • Cooking messages now have 100% more grammar.
  • Parallax now actually moves like it was intended to.
  • Parallax can now be made static in your preferences to get an immobile star background effect.
  • You can now Ctrl-Shift-Click on a PDA to remove its pen.
  • PDAs' examine text will now say if the PDA has a pen or not.
  • Coffee overdoses no longer poison Tajara.
  • Tweaked all mobs' vision flags to hopefully reduce visual glitches with objects mounted on walls.
  • A calibration error in chameleon suits that prevented them from copying some types of clothing has been corrected. Personnel responsible for mistake have been taken care of.
  • Removed the privacy poll.
  • Examining a human-type will no longer explicitly tell you if they are a shell. Are your co-workers really what they say they are?
  • IPC Tags are now located in the head. As such, you no longer need to stare at an IPC's groin to identify it.
  • Replaced our master controller & ProcessScheduler with /tg/'s StonedMC, which should lead to better overall server performance.
  • Added lag-checks to the Singularity.
  • Tesla beams now travel between objects instantly instead of bouncing.
  • Tesla mini-balls will increase the Tesla's bolt rate instead of increasing the energy per bolt.
  • The Tesla will now lose power over time like the singularity if not powered with a particle accelerator.
  • Tweaked how lattices' icons are generated.
  • Added lagchecks to ZAS & Airflow.
  • Fixed a bug where paper's icon did not update in certain cases.
  • Conveyor belts' switches are now more responsive.
  • Refactored a lot of backend code which should lead to better performance or improved response times for certain objects. See the PR on GitHub for details.
  • Slowed down blob growth a bit.
  • Reworked how the server boots up; server restarts should be significantly faster.
  • Added some lag-checks to quick-pickup bags so they won't lag the entire server.
  • Changed how the server sends some resource files to clients in an effort to reduce connection delay.
  • Made some tweaks to the server's decision-making process for when to run lighting updates in an effort to reduce lag.
  • Reduced APC icon update delay.
  • Exosuit fabricators' material insert animation is now colored based on what material is being inserted into the fabricator.
  • Fixed a regression in lighting performance caused by a fix for infinite darkness.
  • Tweaked how some common shades of lighting are drawn client-side in an effort to improve client-side performance in common situations.
  • Tweaked how queued lighting updates are processed, allowing the lighting engine to do partial lighting updates instead of always doing a complete update cycle.
  • Added a new icon generation system for openturfs, allowing mobs & objects below to be drawn in real-time without a meaningful performance impact.
  • Added a safety check to prevent admin commands from starting the game before server initialization has completed.
  • NanoTrasen would like to remind employees that the doors have always made a different noise on close. Do not listen to anyone who claims otherwise, they are lying to you.
  • Airlock doors now actually make a click sound on bolt instead of yelling 'CLICK' at you.
  • Added some updated IV drip sprites from Bay.
  • Some stacks' icons will now reflect how full said stack is.
  • Added some styling to the Voting panel.
  • Lights will now shine through Z-holes (openturfs).

LordFowl updated:

  • After much feedback from players, I have buffed Vaurca starting phoron levels, and phoron gained from all K'ois products.
  • Added K'ois bars to the vending machine until something more immersive is settled on.
  • Fixed Vaurca not spawning with appropriate footwear.
  • Fixed K'ois Spores not properly spawning in hydroponics.
  • Chaplains now have a wider range of alt-titles.
  • Goggles will now blink every 40 seconds, instead of every 4 seconds.
  • Wardens now spawn with a box of blank IDs in their locker, for easily profiling criminals that 'lost' their own ID, or never had one.

MoondancerPony updated:

  • Added a Hoist, deployable via hoist kits. Objects and people can be attached to it and raised/lowered across Z levels without incurring damage.

Nanako updated:

  • Animals nibbling food and cardboard boxes now has a visual and audio effect. No more chatspam!
  • Fixed computer passflags, so they can now properly be crawled under by animals (and fired through because holoscreens are not solid).
  • Fixed a bug where animals could get stuck in a sleeping animation while still awake.
  • Reduced the power of several near-instadeath chems. Most notably mercury and polytrinic acid.
  • Buffed lexorin to be a bit less useless. Changeling death sting is more deadly now.
  • Facing and attack animations now work properly with windows on your tile

Printer16 updated:

  • You can no longer move gun cabinets without unscrewing them and unwrenching them.
  • Talking with a broken jaw is now harder.
  • The railgun, decloner, and mech teleporter have had their research print requirements decreased.
  • A new synthetic tree for the Malf AI featuring various researches relating to their robotic allies.
  • Clicking the reset camera hack without selecting a camera as a Malf AI now pulls up a menu allowing you select which camera you want to hack.
  • The electrical pulse has been replaced with a hack holopad research.
  • The debugger can now fix broken APCs. APCs no longer have a 100% chance to blue screen upon getting hacked.

Skull132 updated:

  • Added the leg actuator RIG module. These allow you to fall from heights if enabled, without taking damage; to leap horizontally (Vox style); and to climb up open turfs if you're facing a solid turf above you. Combat versions also allow you to grapel people.
  • You can now view the reason for your active job ban by clicking on the [BANNED] text on job/role selection.
  • Whitelisted jobs now display as [WHITELISTED] instead of [BANNED] if you are short a whitelist.
  • A restart vote can no longer be called if there are active admins on the server. They will be notified of your attempt, however.
  • Mining flags are now light beacons. For added ambiance and usefulness on the dimly lit asteroid of NewMap.
  • Fixed the bug where your items would vanish if you were to unequip them from personal storage when lying down.
  • Ghost follow links are now /tg/ style and more uniform on the screen.
  • Added the Mixed Secret gamemode, which contains all of the mixed antag modes.
  • Modified the powersink to cause a large powersurge upon reaching its capacity, as opposed to flat out exploding violently. Powersurge causes EMP like effects on connected power nodes, light bursting, and small explosions. Said effects get lessen the further out the items are from range.
  • Labels added with the hand labeler can now be removed.
  • Added customized signatures to character customization. Enjoy!
  • Spiders will no longer create massive stacks of cocoons under dead comrades.
  • Limbs infested with spider eggs will now take longer to burst. When they do burst, the limb is gibbed.
  • Infested limbs will give out more warning now past a certain stage.
  • Modified the spider event. The moderate severity one will now no longer spawn nurses, so they can't multiply.
  • Added a major severity spider event. It spawns more spiders than the moderate severity one along with nurses.
  • Blueprints now work on the asteroid as they would work in space. They also no longer megalag the server to death.
  • Attempting to power the entirety of the asteroid, and thus lagging the server to death, is no longer possible.

Synnono updated:

  • Mushroom pizza no longer tastes like vomit, among other taste tweaks to some recipes. Yum!
  • Sector Command has been convinced to supply additional kitchen staples in the Kitchen Supply Crate.
  • In an effort to keep up with Colonial Chinese fashion trends, four new cheongsam dresses have been added to the custom loadout's dress selection.
  • Women's dress flats in six colors have been added to the custom loadout, in the Shoes and Footwear section.
  • Consulted NanoTrasen cultural sensitivity focus group and added 26 recipes to the kitchen appliances. Also introduced brownie mix to space.
  • Added a new spice to the kitchen's pantry closet.

Wraithcraft updated:

  • Added new hairstyle (Wheeler).

inselc updated:

  • Drones are no longer able to transmit empty messages.
  • Invalid underwear or socks selections will now automatically revert to 'None' when changing the character's gender.

15 June 2017

inselc updated:

  • Mice and drones are no longer able to push lockers around.

13 June 2017

Nanako updated:

  • Fixed personal AI's having all-access to the station. They are now back to only having the access of their master.

16 May 2017

Printer16 updated:

  • Eggplants can now be mutated.
  • RnD can now print flora disks.
  • Crowbars can now lift strata and Linoleum tiles.
  • Blobs can no longer steal tools from borgs.
  • You can now unbuckle someone on a space bike.
  • If you fail to dislocate a limb there will now be a chat message.
  • Increased damage done to all simple_mobs slightly and added proper hit verbs.
  • Smoking pipes have been made small items.
  • IPC's can now wear refitted voidsuits. (Only if refitted to human/skrell)
  • The holodeck thunderdome ready button no longer requires power.

  • Fixed manhacks attacking traitors, heisters and mercenaries.
  • Fixed ipcs being able to repair themselves using cable coil.

01 May 2017

Fire and Glory updated:

  • Brown Hijabs now have sprites.

Lohikar updated:

  • A fault in the production process of polaroid film has been corrected; photos will no longer randomly develop as black.

29 April 2017

Lohikar updated:

  • Fixed an issue where Chauncey's name was not set correctly.
  • Tweaked the grammar of fox and corgi vocalizations slightly.

LordFowl updated:

  • Lobotomy is now a surgical operation. Dislocated brains can also be lobotomized. Lobotomy will permanently damage the brain and remove a target's memories.
  • Placing a brain into an MMI will require a lobotomy to be performed on the brain first.

19 April 2017

Ccomp5950 updated:

  • Objects in bags and other containers (including your hands and pocket) will now hear speach again. This impacts radios, explosive implants, and the universal recorder.

14 April 2017

Lohikar updated:

  • Fixed a bug where RnD machinery with materials inserted could not be disassembled.
  • The lighting engine and cameras have settled their differences and will work properly together now.
  • Made a few elements of camera code slightly less completely stupid, camera lag may be slightly lower.

MoondancerPony updated:

  • Removed blind IPC clairvoyance. IPCs can no longer see when their optics have been removed.
  • Industrial IPCs are now officially rated for low-pressure usage.

Nanako updated:

  • Fixed a lot of missing safety checks in the kitchen that were allowing mice, ghosts and AIs to do things they shouldnt.
  • Fixed reagents combining in cooking container that made certain recipes un-creatable. Chemical reactions will no longer happen in cooking containers.
  • Changed whole eggs to egg yolk instead for a couple of recipes. Also adjusted bread recipe.
  • AI can now turn cooking appliances on/off with a ctrl+click

12 April 2017

MoondancerPony updated:

  • Taught roboticists how to properly remove IPC organs.
  • IPC organs are now encased.

10 April 2017

Lohikar updated:

  • Shells have figured out how to put on socks & undershirts. Synth uprising soon.
  • Repairing holes to space no longer sucks the light out of a room forever.
  • Footstep sounds now actually work without having to take off your boots.
  • NanoTrasen has fired several designers in charge of stations' night-mode control systems after it was revealed that they did not actually know how time works.
  • Red-alert is now kind enough to restore the previous nightmode settings instead of forcing its standards of illumination on the crew.

MoondancerPony updated:

  • Eliminated the possibility for 'double-spending' airlock electronics, duplicating boards and allowing you to complete multiple airlocks with one board.

08 April 2017

MoondancerPony updated:

  • Fixed protohumans.
  • Tajaran subspecies now have their own subspecies of Farwa.

Nanako updated:

  • Added butanol, an alcohol that is safe, though largely ineffective, for humans and most species, but highly intoxicating (and safe in moderation) for unathi. Pure butanol is in the chem dispenser, and can be distilled by combining sugar, corn oil and universal enzyme.
  • Added two new butanol-based drinks, imported from Moghes, they can be found in the bar and rarely in the cargo warehouse.
  • Added a new tajaran spirit, can be found in the bar fridge and sometimes in the warehouse.
  • Kegs of beer or xuizi juice can now be ordered at cargo.
  • Fixed several issues with alcohol effects getting stuck and not wearing off when you sober up.
  • Reduced the rate at which the liver filters alcohol, making it slightly easier to get drunk and take longer to sober up. Drink responsibly!

Printer16 updated:

  • Vampires now know when they finished enthralling someone.
  • The Auxilliary Forensics Tools crate now spawns with a UV light.
  • A Malf AI's advanced encryption hack has been given a lot more space to work with.

inselc updated:

  • Drones are now able to decompile burnt matches.
  • Ghosts will no longer trigger infrared emitters.
  • Transferring chemicals to a chem implant will now show actual amount of reagents transferred.
  • Relocating your/someone's limb will now properly show a message to all bystanders.

03 April 2017

Lohikar updated:

  • Fixed a bug where holstering didn't quite work right with tactical armor.
  • Industrial IPC units' eye controller firmware has been upgraded, fixing a bug where a unit's configured eye color would not display.

Nanako updated:

  • Fixed some issues where creatures being sacrificed to pylons could bug out.

02 April 2017

Alberyk updated:

  • Increased hp, damage and utility of the dark form spell.
  • Healing spells should heal more now.

Lohikar updated:

  • An error in shell manufacturing processes has been corrected; shell units should now be produced with correct eye and skin coloration.
  • Industrials now actually have visible eyes.
  • ERT, CCIA, BSTs, Wizards, and other non-station human-types now no longer skip breakfast before arriving at the station.

  • The mining ore smelter has received some percussive maintenance from the bluespace technicians and now should process iron and carbon correctly.
  • Apparently the smelter conveyor belt isn't supposed to lead into a wall.

  • Robotic internal organ removal surgery now works as intended again.

  • Fixed reagents disappearing from beakers when used to construct circuit imprinters and protolathes.
  • Fixed fax machines getting stuck on '0 seconds remaining'.
  • Suspension field generator can now be unwrenched again.
  • Medical and security record notes formatting fixed to show line breaks for pAI on PDA, and on records in the filing cabinets.
  • Wallet now showing correct sprite after inserting a guest pass.

22 March 2017

Lohikar updated:

  • An update has been issued for all standard-issue PDAs; users note crew manifest no longer causes crashes.

Nanako updated:

  • Slightly reduced the power of cult pylon turrets. This is an iterative process, they will be rebalanced gradually.
  • Fixed an exploit that allowed duplicating items in vendors and buying more than the vendor has.

Skull132 updated:

  • Administrators can now invoke rename-synths verb by normally renaming a character from the VV panel.

19 March 2017

AgentWhatever updated:

  • Two seperate sleek cyborg icons for chemistry and medical.
  • A variation on the heavyMed icon for science. No more mishaps between heavy science and medical borgs
  • Chemistry and medical drone, sleek and advanced droid cyborg icons now selectable by medical module. Rescue cyborgs are set to one variant of sleek, drone or advanced droid.
  • Deleted random pixel in opened cyborg hatch overlay when viewing from the front and battery removed.

Alberyk updated:

  • Ported the baystation version of the wizard gamemode, with modifications and additions.
  • Added new sounds when casting most spells.
  • Ported the newest custom loadout from baystation12.
  • Loadout flask and vacuum-flask can now be prefilled.
  • Added lunchboxes.
  • Added more options to the custom loadout, like winter coats.
  • Added nooses.
  • Tajara and unathi botanists should start with leather gloves now.
  • Alcohol should be more poisonous to unathi now.
  • Claws should be a bit more deadly in combat.
  • Added new custom loadout options.
  • Added ablative and ballistics helmets to the armory.
  • Added arm blades and arm shields abilities to changelings.
  • Added visible messages to certain lings stings.
  • Changelings can now select when getting up after using their regeneration skill.
  • Changeling transform will now change to the species of the selected dna, replacing change species.
  • Changelings can't absorb monkeys anymore.
  • Fixed organ rejection caused by ling transformation.
  • Fixed changeling stings affecting ipcs.
  • Added new sprites for regular, rubber and rifle casings.
  • Changed some gun sprites.
  • Changed the tactical mask sprite.

Arrow768 updated:

  • Added a Client Enrollment App that allows to Enroll a device as either private or as (locked down) work device
  • Various Map Changes
  • Added Wall Mounted Consoles
  • Ported Holo-Warrants from bay. Can be found in the security officers lockers
  • Added a holowarrant to sec borgs. Borgs can now display warrants to the suspects.

Fire and Glory updated:

  • Added Hijab's, obtainable in the heads section of custom loadout.
  • Added a variant of the Unathi robe, obtainable in the xeno section of custom loadout (for Unathi).
  • Added different sprites for Ninja Tajara, Unathi, and Skrell.

Lohikar updated:

  • A new engine type is now orderable from cargo.
  • Smoothed out the animation for area lights such as fire alarms.
  • A progress bar is now shown when you start an action which takes time.
  • IPCs (not including shells) now emit a small amount of light, colored according to their type and screen color.
  • Ported over and improved /vg/'s smooth lighting system.
  • Tweaked the emission color of station lighting.
  • Glowing slime cores now emit colored light instead of white light.
  • Space tiles are now darker.
  • Space tiles now have a parallax effect.
  • Added color to the light of many consoles that did not have one set.
  • You can no longer rotate your view with Rotate-View verbs, as it was breaking lighting.
  • Hallucinations no longer rotate your view for the same reason as above.
  • Colored lighting should mix better now.
  • Rebalanced light emission of most light sources to better fit new lighting system.
  • Lighting now updates immediately when you open an airlock.
  • Completely rewrote lighting system.
  • The game's mob processor should be more robust.
  • Tweaked several of the game's core processes in an effort to reduce lag.
  • Fire alarms should no longer cause lag.
  • Hydroponics trays should no longer cause lag.
  • Fixed an issue where some objects could not be deconstructed with RnD.
  • Helmet lights now actually display the powered-on sprite.
  • Cats on heads no longer magically turn invisible.
  • Cyborgs' portable destructive analyzer can no longer steal intercoms or the captain's safe.
  • Duffle (duffel?) bags now have in-hand sprites.
  • Tweaked how footstep sound effects are played in an effort to improve performance.
  • Re-securing displaced girders now has a delay like was originally intended.
  • Solar panel arrays now use dynamic lighting.
  • Tweaked how movement is handled in an effort to improve responsiveness.
  • Nightmode probably works again. Probably.
  • You can now fold pieces of paper into paper airplanes, which can be thrown farther than unfolded sheets of paper.
  • Flashlights, Floodlights, and Synthetic Integrated lights are now directional.
  • Fixed AIs being unable to set status displays by clicking on them.
  • Tesla links can no longer be installed in laptops and tablets.
  • Most voidsuits should have in-hand sprites once more.
  • Tesla links are now constructable at protolathes as was originally intended.
  • Modular computers now emit different colors of light depending on what program is currently running.
  • Computers' sprites now show if the computer is functional or not.
  • Severed organs inside containers will no longer leave blood drips.
  • M'sai and Zhan-Khazan Tajara can now use prosthetics.
  • Fixed a bug that prevented Coal and Iron ore from spawning on the asteroid.
  • Fixed Engineering's alert consoles displaying as blank.
  • Vampires should now be able to properly embrace thralls.
  • Held mobs such as maintenance drones no longer act as ID cards.
  • NanoTrasen has issued a software update to standard Janitor PDAs; changelogs note custodial supply locator now actually works.
  • Standard-issue automatic flasher units have been exorcised and should no longer be triggered by the dead.
  • After complaints about chickens showing cannibalistic tendencies, Centcomm has changed chicken suppliers.
  • Station-issued chemical dispensers are no longer produced in a haunted factory and should not be affected by the dead.
  • Vending machines have been given a talking to after several synthetics reported tools being forcibly removed for stocking.
  • It is no longer possible to add more languages than your species is physically capable of learning.
  • You can now detach paper shredders from the floor with a wrench.
  • The supermatter's light now changes based on how energetic the crystal is.
  • You can now change your socks at the underwear wardrobe.
  • Refactored sparks & BS Bears to be much less laggy.
  • Fixed bolt lights on doors not emitting light like they were intended to.
  • Maintenance has 100% more ambience.
  • Atmos now has its own ambience sound, distinct from the rest of Engineering.

LordFowl updated:

  • Energy swords and shields can now reflect energy weapon projectiles. The ninja sword additionally can deflect bullets.
  • Added 'Tip of the round' to the lobby. Based off of /tg/'s, it comes with its own Aurora tips too.

Nanako updated:

  • Fixed diona gestalts not having a mouth.
  • Nymphs which evolve into gestalts no longer get Tau Ceti Basic for free. They will only have it if they knew it as a nymph.
  • Diona gestalts now have a second ear slot.
  • Gestalts now remove air from the atmosphere when converting it to nutrition.
  • Rebalanced plant-b-gone versus diona. Also diona can now eat fertilizer.
  • Fixed being unable to build multiple windoors on different sides of the same tile. Also prevented stacking windoors.
  • Reduced the hallucination chance of paroxetine.
  • Added some exosuit charging pads to the mining outpost.
  • Fixed sliced fruit being inedible and the slices just vanishing.
  • Fixed the engiborg inflatables dispenser permanantly breaking if it ran out once.
  • Increased the health of cult juggernauts significantly, and reduced the damage they take from reflected lasers.
  • Reduced the damage of common laser weapons by ~25%. pistols a little more
  • Cooking appliances overhauled majorly. The general flow of cooking has been changed to be less about frantic clicking, and more about time management. All cooking operations now take much longer, but each appliance is capable of doing multiple things synchronously.
  • The fryer and oven now have several removable containers, multiple items can be loaded into each to cook them all at once, combine them into a desired output, or make certain new recipes with them. Multiple containers plus multiple items in each container allows large scale bulk cooking.
  • Oven and fryer both now require pre-heating at the start of a round. this takes 10-15 mins and consumes a lot of power. Don't forget to turn them on!
  • Fryer now has a fairly indepth oil mechanic. Oil levels in the fryer should be kept topped up via a replacement tank, and oil is gradually transferred into food, increasing its nutritional value. Hot oil can also be scooped out and splashed on someone as a decent weapon. A replacement oiltank can sometimes be found in maintenance, otherwise it can be ordered at cargo
  • Oven now has a door that opens and closes. Heat is lost rapidly while its open.
  • The cereal and candy makers now have a single large container, to combine multiple ingredients into cereal or candy.
  • The microwave can now cook multiple copies of the same recipe if all the ingredients are added. And the microwave will no longer produce a burned mess with extra ingredients, as long as there's enough to make a recipe.
  • Many recipes are moved out of the microwave and into the oven or fryer.
  • Moved to fryer: All donuts, cuban carp
  • Moved to Oven: All breads, flatbread, diona roast, all pies, cookie, fortune cookie, all pizzas, enchiladas, monkey delight, pretzel
  • Combination cooking will now change the size of the resulting food item based on the quantity of stuff used to make it. You can make an epic-sized cake if you find enough ingredients. This doesnt affect normal cooking recipes
  • Added a battering mechanic. Batter and beer-batter mixes can be created, and food dipped into them before cooking. This adds lots of calories and changes the appearance of food.
  • Added several new recipes, mainly to the fryer. Many of them require batter.
  • Fixed a ton of bugs related to cooking stuff.
  • Adjusted microwave sprites to pulsate while turned on.
  • Fixed several issues with construct wallsmashing, and made it less spammy.
  • Cult Pylons can now be upgraded into arcane defensive turrets, by sacrificing a small creature. They are weak, but accurate, rapid, and absorb lasers.
  • Improved pylon graphics.
  • Fixed mice never waking up when they went to sleep, and being able to move towards food while sleeping. Also sleeping animals now wake up when interacted with.
  • Cats will now take naps.
  • Mice now alter their pixel offset as they move around.
  • Fixed being unable to repair mechanical organs with nanopaste or screwdriver, these both work now.
  • Screwdriver can no longer be used as a ghetto alternative to bone gel. Use duct tape instead.
  • Energy swords and chainswords can be used to cut open ribs in surgery.
  • Fixed attacking your patient with tools on help intent when there wasnt a valid surgery step.
  • Fixed pillbottle interactions with chemmaster machines.
  • Fixed being asked to pick a cyborg sprite multiple times. Also fixed a missing sprite.
  • Small creatures and projectiles can now move over girders and machinery frames. 50% chance to stop projectiles.
  • Fixed an incorrect message with small creatures climbing onto people.
  • Potted plants can now be killed by fire, explosions, sharp weapons and gunfire
  • Added a large bundle of new potted plant sprites

Printer16 updated:

  • Arming a nuclear device to explode (Saftey off and timer counting down) now raises the code to delta.
  • Traitors can now buy an advanced pinpointer.
  • Added the medal box back.
  • Loyalty implants now have a chance to melt when exposed to EMP's.
  • Microwaves now display a proper message when crowbared.

Skull132 updated:

  • Modified the voting limitation system to only prohibit voting for lobby sitters and ghosts who went straight from the lobby to observing.
  • Replaced staff memos with directly pulling the Discord memos.
  • Added the 'Discord' button to the top right. It will take you to the Discord server if the bot is properly set up!

VikingPingvin updated:

  • Added a filter function for departments in the PDA messenger screen.

14 March 2017

LordFowl updated:

  • Fixed chest-buzzers in Vaurca.

05 March 2017

Skull132 updated:

  • Internal organ repair surgery for mechanical organs now works properly again.

17 February 2017

LordFowl updated:

  • Shells now spawn with fully robotic legs.
  • Green IPC screen has been fixed.

10 February 2017

Alberyk updated:

  • Fixed chairs, beds and stools animated by the staff of animation having no sprites.

07 February 2017

Lohikar updated:

  • Added plastic flaps to medical OR storage to prevent air leakage.
  • Re-added missing cyborg storage units in Drone Fabrication.
  • The engineering outpost's SMES should spawn enabled now.
  • The library's deck of cards should spawn properly now.

03 February 2017

Alberyk updated:

  • Fixed the fake central command announcement, in the traitor uplinks, not working.

30 January 2017

Lohikar updated:

  • Fixed a bug that lead to crates blocking gas flow when they shouldn't, interfering with replacement SM crystal installation.

29 January 2017

Alberky updated:

  • Re-added the loot crates to mining.

25 January 2017

Skull132 updated:

  • Mesons and thermals no longer function as proper night-vision.

23 January 2017

Alberyk updated:

  • Bottles can be smashed against people again.
  • You can't store paper bins inside bags anymore.
  • Changed the sbiten recipe to use mead instead of vodka.

21 January 2017

Alberyk updated:

  • Fixed nutriments on hardsuit injectors modules not providing nutrition correctly.
  • Fixed being unable to fire at point blank with the lawgiver.
  • Fixed some missing unathi and tajaran mask sprites.

Skull132 updated:

  • Fixed voidsuits being weird during unequip and magboots eating shoes.
  • An attempted fix of the AI gaining AOOC and antag status during cult rounds.

20 January 2017

Nanako updated:

  • Remade security spiderborg sprite
  • Rebalanced a wide variety of insignificant events to be a bit more interesting
  • Fixed computer passability for drones, and made kitchen meatsppikes passable.
  • Fixed drunkenness not working.
  • Fixed unusual containers always containing common junk instead of rarer items. Yes this was actually a bug.
  • Service grippers can now pick up trash. Including used plates, bowls, etc
  • CCIA and ERT should have the proper security hud icons now.
  • Added a bulk metal crate to cargo, making it easy to order a large number of metal sheets at once.

19 January 2017

Alberyk updated:

  • Fixed clones spawning dead inside the cloning pod.

15 January 2017

Lohikar updated:

  • Added a fancy new UI to the medical advanced scanner.
  • The medical advanced scanner can print once more.
  • Tweaked how the advanced scanner describes injuries and infections.
  • You can no longer scan IPCs with the adv. scanner.
  • The in-game year should be lore-accurate again.
  • Text-editors on consoles should no longer show [editorbr].

LordFowl updated:

  • Harvesters will cultify the area around them whenever they use their vile magics. Wicked things.
  • Constructs can utilize cult runes properly, provided they are summoned by the cult in the first place.

Nanako updated:

  • Fixed diona nymphs being unable to pass over tables and furniture.
  • Diona nymph walking speed greatly reduced. Nymphs can now sprint

12 January 2017

Lohikar updated:

  • Auto-Hiss should no longer act on sign languages.
  • Auto-Hiss should no longer act on Tajaran languages.
  • Auto-Hiss should no longer act on Unathi languages.
  • Examining an IPC no longer checks their non-existent pulse.
  • You can no longer check the pulse of a species that does not have one.
  • Examining a human-type mob with robotic limbs no longer shows red examine text for each limb.
  • Examining a human-type mob now shows hunger level again.
  • The Ninja's self-destruct should actually kill the Ninja now.
  • You can no longer use sign language over radios.

Nanako updated:

  • Cyborg grippers now show their contents on their icon and when examined.
  • Fixed many bugs with grippers, and made them more robust to reduce future bugs.
  • Added a MASSIVE quantity of new cyborg chassis sprites. Some are added to every module. All sprites taken from other codebases including VG station, TG station, paradise, and baystation. All licensed under GPL.
  • Using an empty gripper on a mob now does an action depending on your attack intent.

Skull132 updated:

  • Re-added the character delete button.
  • Fixed borg scanners.
  • Fixed a case of the colour squares on character creation showing wrong colours.
  • Fixed underwear/socks/undershirts bugging out on incompatible saved data.
  • Fixed not being able to infect any human mobs (monkeys included) with viruses via injection.
  • Fixed spacelube not drying ever. It still takes a shit load of time, however.

11 January 2017

Alberyk updated:

  • You can now apply splints to hands and feet.
  • Nanopaste can be used to fix robotics limbs now.

Nanako updated:

  • Mousetraps will now trigger when walked on. Also nerfed the instastun for shoeless mobs stepping on them.
  • Fixed several mouse related bugs.
  • Fixed the individual respawn times not working. Respawning should now work as before
  • Cloaking devices now use power, the cell can be removed for charging or replacement with a screwdriver.
  • Cloaking devices now hide the user from rightclick menus, and in general make them harder to hit.
  • Cloaking device is now available in traitor uplinks. Costs 14 TC, its very powerful.
  • Added an *idle emote for people with tails to reset their tail wagging to the default speeds.
  • Fixed a bug where dead or SSD crewmembers would constantly try to stop wagging their tail (even if they don't have one) causing some lag.

08 January 2017

Lohikar updated:

  • Refactored printing.

07 January 2017

Alberyk updated:

  • Added new sprites for the captain voidsuit, with xeno versions as well.
  • Added bluesec sprites for the corporate security uniforms.
  • You can now roll up sleeves of certain jumpsuits.
  • Added socks.
  • Paramedics and emts have access to firelocks now.
  • Added new cooking machines to the kitchen, ported from Baystation.
  • Added Siik'Tajr as an alternative language for tajaran.
  • Added new barsigns.
  • Re-added the HONKER exosuit.
  • Fixed suit cooling unit not working when worn on the back.
  • Fixed suit cooling unit not working when inside mechas.
  • Force gloves have an unique sprite now.
  • Added hooded winter jackets.
  • Tweaked the hos gear to be far more uniform now.
  • Added a frag grenade module to the syndicate cyborg.
  • Added a rather explosive failsafe device to syndicate borgs.
  • Added space-bikes.
  • Added a new alternative language for unathi.
  • Replaced the station nuclear fission explosive with something else.
  • Fixed hide behaving like metal sheets.
  • Fixed being unable to remove the medal of captaincy from the captain jumpsuit.
  • Added new custom loadout options, like tracksuits and the atlas armband.
  • Waistcoats and suspenders are now accessories instead of suits.
  • Tabling weakening should be more random now.

Arrow768 updated:

  • Char Records are now properly nulled when a new char is created
  • Security Incidents are now persisted across rounds
  • Players can delete their own incidents in the records menu

Bedshaped updated:

  • Bayport: Scrubbers are now weldable.
  • Fixed incorrect messages when welding vents.
  • Moved badge overlays to opposite side of uniform.

Lohikar updated:

  • Telecomms machines now have open-panel sprites.
  • Added a new particle accelerator sprite.
  • IPCs can now use *beep, *ping and *buzz.
  • Fixed formatting of forms when held up to a security camera.
  • Fixed grammar error in IA and CE's headsets.
  • Global nightmode toggle no longer affects security as was originally intended.
  • Manually turning on nightmode will prevent the automatic system from turning it off.
  • Added a night-mode control program for the Chief Engineer.
  • Changed how night-mode works internally.
  • Red alert now disables night-mode.
  • Slightly changed alert messages.
  • Speculative fix for perpetual night-mode.
  • Explosions should no longer lock up the server.
  • Significantly reduced lag from most things.
  • Fire alarms are constructable again.
  • Fire alarms now use NanoUI.
  • Fire alarms now indicate on the alarm sprite when they're activated.
  • Some AI displays now have special icons used when the AI is dead.
  • Added an admin verb that allows force-storaging of SSD AIs.
  • The AI's icon now changes when it is EMPed.

LordFowl updated:

  • Borgs that self-destruct will now cause a small explosion and launch a variable amount of very painful shrapnel.
  • It is no longer possible to put chelms into MMIs.
  • Removing cells from industrial mining drills now requires a crowbar.
  • Industrial mining drills have been made more dangerous.
  • Blobs have been made more dangerous.
  • Correctly set the tag of the IAA's request console.
  • Added request console to warden's office.
  • Ported over Apollo's infraction system, and overhauled it to fit our regulations.
  • Any minor or medium infractions will be semi-permanently attached to a player's metadata, creating a permanent criminal record.
  • Added a sentencing computer to the warden's office and brig processing to tie into the infractions overhaul. Documentation on operation is available in-game.
  • Added two new IPC subspecies - Shell Frame and Industrial Frame. Renamed main species to Baseline Frame.
  • All IPCs now spawn with the tagger organ in their groin, which accurately identifies them unless removed.
  • Organics can select synthskin prosthetics, but only of their own species.
  • Shells can now only mimic a single species - no more multi-species abominations.
  • IPCs can now change their body colour.
  • Seperated Vaurcae into two subspecies - Worker and Warrior, who have minor stat differences and very slight aesthetic differences.
  • Added an internal phoron tank to Vaurcae, replacing the functionality of the filtration bit.
  • Vaurcae now require phoron to breathe, and are poisoned by nitrogen. They can acquire phoron either from their internal tank, or external tanks.
  • Vaurca filtration bit is now used to convert ingested phoron (in pill or foodstuff form) into gaseous phoron for their internal tank.
  • A Vaurcae lesser form has been created: V'krexi.
  • Vaurcae functionality to the auto-hiss'er has been created.
  • Vox Armalis and related items have been recreated for adminbus and staff of change shenanigans.
  • Vaurcae Breeder and related items have been created for adminbus, staff of change, and genetic shenanigans.
  • Vaurcae sprint has been modified to be more effective, particularly for Warriors.
  • Vaurcae tox-loss and blood-loss have been tweaked to make them both significantly less deadly, but still vulnerabilities.
  • The cloner wil now no longer clone mechanical organs or limbs.
  • Vaurcae can now be cloned, however none of their mechanical organs will be cloned with them.
  • K'ois has now been made far less effective, providing less nutrition and less produce.

Nanako updated:

  • Added some public consoles to the library.
  • Bartender, chaplain and librarian get their own consoles in their workspace.
  • Computer consoles can now be walked under by small animals, and will usually not block projectiles.
  • Reworked exosuit tracking beacons into two types, one with and one without a killswitch.
  • Tracking beacons can now be removed. Opening the panel is necessary to install or remove them.
  • EMP effects against exosuits are less directly damaging but cause more side effects and malfunctions.
  • Added some audio to a couple of maintenance operations on exosuits.
  • Hopefully fixed a bug where picked up animals would instantly die.
  • Adjusted several event probabilities for better variety, and a little less major events.
  • Added Rabbit pai image option, and pais can now be picked up in expanded form, ported from baystation
  • Added in-hand sprites for mice, ported from baystation
  • Construction drones now have unique sprites for being held in hand and worn on head.
  • Pais are now collapsed with an alt + click. Normal clicks will do similar things to animals, petting, kicking, etc.
  • pAIs when unfolded can now be scooped up, held and worn on your head.
  • Bicaridine metabolises a little faster but heals less
  • Fixed bicaridine not properly healing internal bleeding.
  • Footstep sounds adjusted on several different kinds of floors. Notably plating and carpets.
  • Nutrition is now randomised on spawning
  • Reduced Diona nymph health a bit
  • Diona nymphs no longer gain light while ventcrawling inside a pipe. Hiding in there too long will be fatal.
  • Overhauled all of the security hud job icons, to be larger, more visually pleasing and better communicate roles
  • Intern positions, paramedics and psychiatrists now have an icon. All jobs that were missing an icon should be fixed
  • Made the loyalty implant icon a less obtrusive green light, instead of a big red square
  • CCIA, ERT, IAA, bluespace techs and any similar nanotrasen representatives should now have the N logo as their icon
  • Mice and lizards will now decompose to a skeleton 30mins after death, or if turned to dust by something (like the supermatter)
  • Enhanced functionality of the Bee smoker, found in the beekeeping crate at cargo. It now runs on welder fuel, and can generate directed clouds of smoke. Can be used to calm mobile, angry bees.
  • The bee net is now fully functional and can be used to capture bees and release them elsewhere, or return them to an open hive. Docile/calm bees are easier to catch.
  • Beekeeping crate now includes lots of extra equipment to start your honey empire!
  • New sprites for beesmoker
  • Volume and quantity of bee buzzing sounds nerfed
  • Bee maximum damage reduced by 15%
  • Added a sudoku game to modular computers, available to everyone on all platforms
  • Crates can now be hoisted ontop of tables, takes time depending on how heavy it is. Crates on tables will always block projectiles, making them easier to shoot with emitters and good cover
  • Crates can now be slid under tables. They must be closed to do this, and cannot be opened while under a table. Combined with the above, this allows stacking of up to two crates on one tile.
  • The morgue, medical cold storage, AI core and AI upload, are now refridgerated areas (5 celsius). The kitchen freezer is a sub-zero area at -20 celsius.
  • Morgue, medical storage, AI core, AI upload, kitchen freezer and research server room, all now have high-power air alarms that use 3x as much power and are better at regulating temperatures.
  • Power costs of all air alarms increased a little.
  • Fixed a bug where thermostats wouldn't work if set to 0 celsius. Thermostats will now also clamp inputs to the nearest valid temperature instead of discarding invalid input.
  • Kitchen rearranged slightly to make more sense. Equipment moved out of freezer, flaps added to keep heat out.
  • ChemMaster and Condimaster machines can now be unwrenched and moved around.

Printer16 updated:

  • Removed empty jetpacks playing a sound.
  • A malfunctioning AI's advanced encyrption hack now prints a paper at the communications console.
  • Intercepted messages now say 'to' depending if it intercepted the message sender.
  • Cleanbots no longer make emotes when they are unable to find their path (How would you know anyways?) They are also a lot more quite.
  • You can no longer join as a mouse before roundstart.
  • The maintenance drone poster no longer has a typo.
  • For malfunctioning AI, the system override research now takes longer.
  • With the change above, it now takes less time to research forcefields and machine override.
  • The turret enhancer hardware is slightly buffed to make it more useful.
  • There is now a slightly smaller fail and critical fail chance for the malfunctioning AI's Advanced and Elite hack.
  • You can no longer fill fire extiguishers with blank units.
  • You can't spam buy services anymore.
  • CE hardsuit is more resistant to fires. RD hardsuit is more resistant to EMP's, but slightly weaker.

Serveris updated:

  • Added new gear and weaponry, available to Emergency Response Teams.
  • Remapped the NTCC Odin ERT Divison, introducting the tactical vending machine, containg some new gear and providing better storage for exisiting gear.
  • Added several new admin loadouts for ERT and DO escorts.
  • Added a variant of the new tactical vending machine to security, with slight differences to the ERT variant.
  • ERT no longer have access to the entire CC station; DOs now have access to most of it.
  • ERT are now loyalty implanted -printer16

Skull132 updated:

  • Chat mark-up now requires whitespace (or radio tokens, in case of radio speech) to surround mark-up markers for them to be valid. "/this will/ work," "as /will/ this," ":s/and this./" But, "/this will not /work." This enables you to use words with underscores in them, and to type type-paths and other things in BYOND.
  • Mark-up no longer nukes BYOND server addresses.
  • IPCs now have a very minor chance of getting shocked from feeding on APCs. There's 0 chance of getting shocked from using a cyborg recharger, though. To that end, also added 1 extra borg recharger into arrivals bathroom.
  • The server greeting window now only updates your saved hashes (makes tabs not yellow) if you actually view what's in them. Opening and closing the greeting without viewing at the individual tabs no longer toggles them as read.
  • Added an admin command for R_DEBUG and R_SERVER flag owners to toggle the global default explosion type.
  • Rewrote the entire SQL saving and loading system. On top of the backend changes, it is important to note that a character's name cannot be edited after 5 days since the creation of the character.
  • Removed the ability to play a character with a random name.
  • Fixed old character data not being wiped if you press the New Character button.
  • Fixed the skill level not being recalculated properly upon loading a character from SQL.

29 December 2016

Lohikar updated:

  • Fixed a bug where certain mob types died forever.

24 December 2016

Atlantis updated:

  • Setup Supermatter admin button now uses map markers and supports all coolant types.
  • Floodlight upgrade added. This upgrade doubles robot's light intensity (it will be more or less same as actual floodlight), at the cost of higher power usage.
  • You may now install matter bin into a cyborg in order to boost it's matter synth's maximal capacity. Better matter bin adds more capacity
  • Default capacity of matter synths for engineering module tweaked a little, since prices of reinforced walls, etc. increased recently. Steel changed from 40 to 60 sheets default, plasteel from 10 (Construction default) to 20.
  • SMES units now try to balance their inputs and outputs. For outputs this means two SMESes powering the same grid will share the load by percentage. For inputs, all SMESes inputting from one power network will split the available power by percentage.
  • Some minor SMES configuration changes have been made: Atmospherics SMES now starts configured to prevent power outages when people forget about it, engine SMESes are now configured to input/output at full rate. These are only defaults and may be changed ingame as usual.
  • Removed old computer3 system, most noticeable due to removal of old laptops.
  • Adds brand new modular computer system that replaces computer3. These computers may run programs from hard drive, and one device is not limited to one program.
  • Modular computers can be assembled manually from components printed at RnD (Consoles mainly), or purchased (from old laptop vending machines).
  • Adds NTNet, networking used by modular computers, including an administration console, NTNet relays, and antag programs.
  • Adds small set of programs modular computers can run. More programs will be added in the future.
  • Various small things added, such as, data crystals (USB flash drives), NTNRC (messaging, IRC/forum style), file sending, etc.
  • Added Inflatables Dispenser(ID), an item that allows rapid deployment, transport and removal of inflatables.
  • Engineering, Construction and Crisis modules are now outfitted with ID.
  • Three boxes in engineering have been replaced by three IDs.
  • w_classes of inflatables readjusted. Boxes and IDs can be carried in backpack now. Individual inflatables are small enough to fit in pocket.
  • NanoUI for Robotics Control Console
  • NanoUI for Supermatter Crystal - AI/Robot only, purely informational
  • Converted phoron glass to borosilicate glass, adjusted heat resistances accordingly, got rid of copypaste fire code. Fire resistance is now handled by variables so completely fireproof windows are possible with varedit.
  • Windows take fire damage when heat exceeds 100C regular windows, 750C reinforced regular, 2000C borosilicate and 4000C reinforced borosilicate. For comparsions, reinforced walls begin taking damage around 6000.
  • Expanded gridcheck random event. Affected devices now show error UI and may be restarted manually before the event ends. All Z-levels are now affected equally.

Chinsky updated:

  • Can pick up monkeys / undress resomi now properly. HELP intent for scooping, NON-HELP for undressing.
  • Meat limbs now can be attached. Use limb on missing area, then hemostat to finalize it.
  • Limbs from other races can be now attached. They'll cause rejection, but it can be kept at bay with spaceacilline to some point. Species special attack is carried over too, i.e. you can clawn people if you sew a cathand to yourself.
  • Limbs that are left in open will rot in ~7 minutes. Use freezers or cryobags to stop it. You can still attach them, but you wish you couldn't.
  • Updated penlights to be more of use in diagnostics, they now show following conditions:
  • Eye damage
  • Blurry eyes (overall slower reaction)
  • Brain damage (one eye reacts slower)
  • Opiates use (pinpoint pupils)
  • Drugs use (dilated pupils)
  • Made capguns into proper guns code-wise. It means you can now take people hostage with them, stick in your mouth, and all other things you can do with real guns but probably shouldn't.
  • Russian roulette! Fun for whole sec team! Unload some shells from revolver, spin the cylinder(verb) and you're good to go!

Datraen updated:

  • Objects can now be yanked out of synthetics.

GinjaNinja32 updated:

  • Changed language selection to allow multiple language selections, changed humans/unathi/tajarans/skrell to not automatically gain their racial language, instead adding it to the selectable languages for that species. Old slots will warn when loaded that the languages may not be what you expect.
  • Added an auto-hiss system for those who would prefer the game do their sss or rrr for them. Activate via Toggle Auto-Hiss in the OOC tab.
  • Auto-hiss system in 'basic' mode will extend 's' for Unathi and 'r' for Tajara. 'Full' mode adds 'x' to 'ks' for Unathi, and is identical to 'basic' mode for Tajara.

HarpyEagle updated:

  • Renames many guns to follow a consistent naming style. Updated and changed gun description text to be more lore-friendly.
  • Throwing a booze bottle at something nearby while on harm intent causes it to smash, splashing it's contents over whatever it hits.
  • Rags can now be wrung out over a container or the floor, emptying it's contents into the container or splashing them on the floor.
  • Rags can now be soaked using the large water and fuel tanks instead of just beakers.
  • Rags soaked in welding fuel can be lit on fire.
  • Rags can now be stuffed into booze bottles. When the bottle smashes, the stuffed rag is dropped onto the ground.
  • Fixed eggs having a ridiculously large chemical volume.
  • T-Ray scanner effects are now only visible to the person holding the scanner.
  • Traitors can now purchase the C-20r and the STS-35 for telecrystals.
  • Adds armour penetration mechanic for projectiles and melee weapons.
  • Laser carbines, LWAP, and shotgun now have a small amount of armour penetration, ballistic rifles (not SMGs) have moderate amounts, laser cannon has high armour penetration, and the PTR mostly ignores body armour.
  • Shotgun slugs and Z8/STS damage has been lowered slightly to accomodate for their higher penetration. In general ballistics deal less damage but have higher penetration than comparable laser weapons. Notable exception: X-Ray lasers have had their damage lowered slightly but gain very high armour penetration.
  • Energy swords now have very high armour penetration. Ninja blades do less damage but ignore armour completely.
  • Shields no longer block attacks from directly behind the player.
  • Riot shields no longer stop bullets or beams (except for beanbags and rubber bullets), however they are now more effective at blocking melee attacks and thrown objects.
  • Energy shields block melee attacks as effectively as riot shields do. Their ability to block projectiles is largely unchanged.
  • Melee weapons now only block melee attacks.
  • Two handed weapons have a small chance of blocking melee attacks when wielded in two hands.
  • Sound and visual effects when blocking attacks with an energy shield or energy sword.
  • Fixed dead or unconscious people blocking stuff with shields.

Hubblenaut updated:

  • Mobs on help intent will not push others that aren't.
  • Adds glass bottles for Cola, Space Up and Space Mountain Wind to Booze-O-Mat.
  • Some bar drink recipes have been amended to easily sum to 30 units for drinking glasses.
  • Vendors now have a product receptor for accepting goods. Opening the maintenance painel is no longer required.
  • Wrenching a vending machine is no longer a silent action.
  • Stepup: Item placement on 4x4 grids seemed to work great. Now we'll try 8x8.
  • Light replacers now hold up to 32 light bulbs.
  • Light replacers can be obtained through janitorial supply crates.
  • A sheet of glass fills the light replacer by 16 bulbs.
  • Bruise packs are now applied per wound, not per limb.
  • Bruise packs now use a delay depending on wound severity for applying.
  • Removed instant healing ability from advanced bruise packs and ointment.
  • Adds tape for atmospherics.
  • Tape graphics and algorithm changes. Looks a lot more appealing now.
  • Starting and ending tape on the same turf will connect it to all surrounding walls/windows.
  • Lifting a part of the tape will lift an entire tape section.
  • Mobs on help intent do stop for tape.
  • Crumpled tape does not affect tape breaking behavior anymore.

Karolis2011 updated:

  • Improved modular computer performance

Kelenius updated:

  • AI now hears LOOC both around its eye and its core, and speaks in LOOC around its eye. Keep in mind that you won't hear and won't be heard if there is a wall between your eye and the target.
  • Bees have been updated and are totally worth checking out (beekeeping crate at cargo).
  • Sleeper consoles removed. All interaction is now done by clicking on the sleeper itself.
  • To put people into sleeper, you now have to click-drag people to it. Grabs no longer work. To exit the sleeper, move.
  • Sleeper now uses a NanoUI.
  • Click cooldowns have been removed on pretty much everything that isn't an attack.
  • Mechfab can now be upgraded using RPED, and now uses NanoUI.

Loganbacca updated:

  • Added a backend (wireless) system for communication between machinery and other devices.

Matthew951 updated:

  • Added Vincent Volaju's hair.
  • Added Vincent Volaju's beard.

Neerti updated:

  • The AI can now toggle whether its hologram will move towards the center of its view using the 'Toggle Hologram Movement' verb.

Orelbon updated:

  • Changed the HoP's suit to more vibrant colors and hopefully you will like it.

PsiOmegaDelta updated:

  • Can now click held mobs, such as Pun Pun, to view their inventory.
  • Uplink crystals can now be converted into physical form to allow transfer between uplink devices.
